column1: Figure 3: Alternative measures of inequality have increased to highest levels over the 10-year period to financial year ending 2022
S80/S20 ratio, P90/P10 ratio, Palma ratio, and top 1% share, equivalised disposable income, all people, UK, 1977 to financial year ending 2022

column2:
1. FYE 2022, which represents the financial year ending 2022, (April to March), and similarly for all other years expressed in this format. 
2. Estimates of income inequality from FYE 2002 onwards have been adjusted for the under-coverage of top earners. 
3. Estimates up to and including financial year ending (FYE) 2017 are sourced from the Living Costs and Food (LCF) survey. Estimates from FYE 2018 onwards are based on the Household Finances Survey, which the LCF is part of.
